Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers are going with a parade of relievers as they try to close out the New York Mets in Game 6 of the NL Championship Series on Sunday night.
New York is going with Sean Manaea at Dodger Stadium.
Manaea is 2-0 with a 2.65 ERA in playoff starts, including a Game 2 victory at Dodger Stadium against LA’s bullpen.
Manager Carlos Mendoza is considering a potential lineup of Jesse Winker at designated hitter again and Jeff McNeil back at second base.
Dodgers first baseman Freddie Freeman’s status for Game 6 is uncertain due to a sprained right ankle.
Dodgers catcher Will Smith was replaced by a pinch hitter in Game 5 after taking either a foul tip or a bat to his catching hand, but tests were negative and he is expected to play Sunday.
Dodgers second baseman Gavin Lux won’t start Sunday because of an injured hip that limited him to a pinch-hit appearance in Game 5.
Mets outfielder Brandon Nimmo has been playing with plantar fasciitis in his left foot.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series returns to the warmth of California with Sunday’s forecast calling for temperatures in the high 70s by first pitch before dropping to the 60s as the game goes on.
Shohei Ohtani’s wife, Mamiko, and their dog, Decoy, have been low-profile regulars at Dodger Stadium during the playoffs.
Freddie Freeman’s injury status is a key factor in the Dodgers’ decision-making for Game 6.
